description: From Middle French atrocité, from Latin atrox (“terrible, cruel”), from āter (“matte black”).

entries.meaning: (countable) An extremely cruel act; a horrid act of injustice.
examples: to carry out / commit / perpetrate an atrocity
The regime is guilty of mass atrocities including forced displacement and the use of chemical weapons.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The quality or state of being atrocious; enormous wickedness; extreme criminality or cruelty.
(countable) An object considered to be extremely unattractive or undesirable.
